name: Togo
description: Togo is a landlocked country in West Africa, known for its diverse landscapes, including coastal plains, rainforests, and savanna. It’s a nation with a rich cultural heritage, influenced by its history as a French colony and its traditional Vodun beliefs. Togo faces challenges related to poverty and infrastructure, but is actively working towards sustainable development and tourism.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Lomé is the economic and political center of Togo.
quickFacts.detail: It’s a bustling port city located on the Gulf of Guinea.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Togo has a young and growing population.
quickFacts.detail: The median age is approximately 19 years.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: French is the official language of Togo.
quickFacts.detail: Ewe and Kabye are also widely spoken indigenous languages.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Togo's land area is relatively small.
quickFacts.detail: It's roughly the size of Vermont in the United States.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Togo's economy is largely based on agriculture.
quickFacts.detail: Cocoa and cotton are key export commodities.

climateData.title: Climate of Togo
climateData.description: Togo experiences a tropical savanna climate, characterized by distinct wet and dry seasons. The coastal areas are humid, while the inland regions are drier.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season brings cooler temperatures and less rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The wet season is marked by heavy rainfall and high humidity.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Harmattan Winds
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A dry, dusty wind blows from the Sahara Desert, bringing cooler temperatures and reduced visibility.

naturalWonders.name: Kpassce Waterfalls
naturalWonders.description: Kpassce Waterfalls are a series of stunning cascades located in the Kegué Mountains. They offer a refreshing escape into the heart of Togo's rainforest.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The falls are formed by the Kegué River plunging over multiple tiers, creating a dramatic and picturesque scene. The surrounding area is rich in biodiversity, with a variety of plant and animal life.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Etame
naturalWonders.description: Mount Etame is the highest peak in Togo, offering panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This dormant volcano is a challenging but rewarding climb, providing a glimpse into Togo's geological history. The summit is covered in unique flora adapted to the high altitude.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Togo
ecosystemData.overview: Togo’s ecosystems range from coastal rainforests to savanna grasslands and montane forests. These diverse habitats support a rich array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Togo’s forests are home to a vast array of plant and animal species, including primates, birds, and reptiles.

biodiversityCategories.name: Savanna
biodiversityCategories.description: The savanna grasslands of Togo support large grazing animals and a variety of bird species.

activities.title: Activities in Togo
activities.description: Togo offers a range of activities for adventure seekers and nature enthusiasts.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Togo’s diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Mount Etame Hike
activities.description: A challenging trek to the summit of Mount Etame, offering stunning views.
activities.requirements: Good physical fitness, hiking boots, warm clothing

activities.name: Kpassce Waterfalls Trail
activities.description: A scenic trail leading to the Kpassce Waterfalls.

activityCategories.name: Wildlife Viewing
activityCategories.description: Observe Togo’s diverse wildlife in their natural habitat.

activities.name: Fauna Reserve Safari
activities.description: Explore protected areas and observe wildlife such as elephants, monkeys, and birds.
safety: Maintain a safe distance from animals
